Author: tholin

Author: 246tnt
Content: And there is a marker layer (purely informational, doesn't mean anything for manufacturing) to tell klayout that a given transistor is meant to be 5V and not 6V.

Author: 246tnt
Content: v5_xtor

Author: tholin
Content: `string MASKHINTS_V5_XTOR` does not have an effect. Will actually have to draw this in KLayout.

Author: 246tnt
Content: Yeah, MASKHINTS only works if support for maskhints for that particular layer is in the tech file.

Author: 246tnt
Content: @Tim Edwards it seems `magic` isn't creating that layer at all, I see no support for writing it in the tech file ?

Content: But also, these are supposed to be 6V devices

Author: tholin

Author: tholin
Content: There is weird things going on here

Author: tholin
Content: Oh no, the transistors are indeed too small for 6V devices - and magic doesn’t see a problem with that.

Author: tholin
Content: In other words, I’d like to report a bug...

Author: 246tnt
Content: I'm guessing the `mv` devices (which are the ones used in your design) are meant to be the 5V one and the `hv` would be the 6V ones.

Author: 246tnt
Content: Ah no, I think magic doesn't differentiate between 5V and 6V devices at all.

Author: 246tnt
Content: both are `mvnfet` / `mvpfet` and it's just whatever length you use that will dictate which one it is ...

Author: tholin
Content: hv is 10V

Author: tholin
Content: GF180mcu has LV, MV 5V, MV 6V, Native Vt, HV LDMOS

Author: tholin
Content: Which are 3.3V, 5V, 6V, 6V and 10V respectively.
